description: Simulation of abrupt termination of ocean alkalinsation in 2070 during an emission driven SSP5-8.5 scenario (part of the CDR-ocean-alk experiment).  All anthropogenic, solar, and volcanic forcing. Anthropogenic forcing includes aerosol emissions, non-CO2 greenhouse gas emissions, and land use changes.  CO2 concentration calculated (i.e. emission driven).
long_name: emission-driven SSP5-8.5 scenario with alkalinization terminated in year 2070
rationale: Evaluate the Earth system response to ocean alkalinization during a high CO2 emission climate change scenario.

requirements.description: Run from 2070 for a maximum of 4950 years.
requirements.label: 2070-7019 4950yrs max

requirements.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model with biogeochemistry
requirements.keywords: AOGCM, BioGeoChemistry, AOGCM-BGC, Atmosphere-Ocean General Circulation Model
requirements.label: AOGCM-BGC Configuration
